title: Saratoga National Historical Park: Park Home
body: A Crucial American Victory  Here in the autumn of 1777, American forces met, defeated and forced a major British army to surrender.  This crucial American victory in the Battle of Saratoga renewed patriots’ hopes for independence, secured essential foreign recognition and support, and forever changed the face of the world. Read More               Saratoga Battlefield   Saratoga Battlefield is the largest of 4 parts making up Saratoga National Historical Park.        Philip Schuyler House   The country estate of Philip Schuyler: surveyor, businessman, American Revolutionary War general, and perhaps father of America's canals.              Saratoga Monument   Built in the last quarter of the 19th century, Saratoga Monument commemorates the American victory in the Battles of Saratoga.        Victory Woods   General Burgoyne's British Army, retreating north from the Americans, made this ridge their final defense before their surrender.
